hypotheses.title: Unauthorized Access Attempts by Non-Existent User Accounts
hypotheses.action: Search for failed logon attempts by non-existent user accounts within a 1h window.

sigma.yaml:
title: Failed Logon Attempts by Non-Existent Users
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: security
  category: authentication
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 4625
      Status: 0xC0000064
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=security EventCode=4625 Status=0xC0000064 | stats count by AccountName, ComputerName, TimeGenerated | where count >= 2

hypotheses.findings_example: User 'unknown_user' failed to log on to 'SERVER01' 3 times within 1 hour.

methodologies_enriched.name: Default Accounts
methodologies_enriched.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a default account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion. Default accounts are those that are built

hypotheses.title: Service Creation by Non-Existent Users
hypotheses.action: Search for services created by non-existent accounts in a 10m window.

sigma.yaml:
title: Service Creation by Non-Existent Users
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: security
  category: service_creation
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 7045
      ServiceAccount|contains: "NON_EXISTENT"
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=security EventCode=7045 ServiceAccount="*NON_EXISTENT*" | stats count by ServiceName, ServiceAccount, Computer | where count >= 1

hypotheses.findings_example: Service 'FakeService' created by 'NON_EXISTENT_USER' on 'SERVER02' within 10 minutes.

hypotheses.title: Failed Privilege Escalation Attempts by Non-Existent Users
hypotheses.action: Monitor for failed attempts to escalate privileges by non-existent users within a 5m window.

sigma.yaml:
title: Failed Privilege Escalation Attempts by Non-Existent Users
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: security
  category: privilege_escalation
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 4673
      SubjectUserName|contains: "NON_EXISTENT"
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=security EventCode=4673 SubjectUserName="*NON_EXISTENT*" | stats count by Privilege, SubjectUserName, Computer | where count >= 1

hypotheses.findings_example: Non-existent user 'phantom_user' attempted to use 'SeDebugPrivilege' on 'LAPTOP-5678' within 5 minutes.
